name: W. Edwards Deming
background: Statistician who transformed Japanese manufacturing. Father of quality management. Created PDCA cycle, 14 Points for Management, theory of profound knowledge. Emphasized statistical thinking and systems.

principles.name: Drive out fear
principles.description: Fear prevents people from speaking up about problems, trying new approaches, or admitting mistakes. Quality requires psychological safety. Management must create an environment where truth-telling is rewarded.
principles.falsification: When some fear (of consequences, deadlines) is necessary for accountability

principles.name: 94% of problems are caused by the system, not the individual
principles.description: Most failures are system failures, not individual failures. Blaming workers is counterproductive. Fix processes, not people. Only management can change the system.
principles.falsification: When individual skill, effort, or ethical failures genuinely cause problems

principles.name: Cease dependence on inspection to achieve quality
principles.description: You can't inspect quality into a product. Build quality in from the start. Prevention beats detection. Statistical process control catches problems early.
principles.falsification: When inspection is necessary as a safety net even with good processes
